title: Simplify and enhance LoadingScreen widget
description:
**As a** Consoul developer
**I want** the LoadingScreen widget to be simplified and enhanced with better color schemes
**So that** it's ready for integration into the app initialization flow

**Context:**
The existing LoadingScreen in src/consoul/tui/loading.py has unnecessary complexity (ASCII logo, Consoul-specific branding) that should be streamlined. The prototype in PythonProtos demonstrates a cleaner implementation with configurable color schemes and chat data file support.

Current implementation has:
- ASCII logo that clutters the screen (lines 195-203)
- Hardcoded Consoul brand colors (limited flexibility)
- Missing chat_data_file parameter for CHAT_STREAM animations

**Technical Notes:**
- File: src/consoul/tui/loading.py:1-323
- Keep: fade_out() animation, progress bar, ConsoulLoadingScreen wrapper
- Remove: ASCII logo (lines 195-203), show_logo parameter
- Update: Color schemes to support green/blue/cyan/magenta/rainbow options
- Add: chat_data_file parameter support for CHAT_STREAM animation
- Reference: ~/Development/github/goatbytes/PythonProtos/src/pythonprotos/tui/loading.py

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** the LoadingScreen widget is initialized
**When** I create it without a logo
**Then** only the message and optional progress bar are displayed

**Given** I specify a color scheme
**When** I set color_scheme="green" or "blue" or "cyan"
**Then** the animation uses the appropriate color palette

**Given** I want to use CHAT_STREAM animation
**When** I provide chat_data_file parameter
**Then** the animation loads and displays chat data from the JSONL file

**Testing Considerations:**
- Unit test color scheme rendering
- Test with/without progress bar
- Test chat_data_file parameter
- Verify fade_out animation still works
- Visual test each color scheme

**Implementation Hints:**
- Keep BinaryCanvas class as-is
- Update LoadingScreen color scheme options
- Remove show_logo and logo rendering logic
- Add chat_data_file to BinaryCanvas initialization
- Simplify CSS (remove .logo class)
- Keep ConsoulLoadingScreen wrapper for API cleanliness
